–ü—É—Å–∫–∏ –ö–ê–ë –Ω–∞ –î–æ–Ω–µ—á—á–∏–Ω—É.
Cruise missiles (likely Iskander-K) entered Sumy Oblast, flying to Konotop on a western course.
The missile(s) disappeared southeast of Konotop, Sumy Oblast. Multiple Geran-2 drones are now flying in that area. No explosions were reported.

There are still no missiles detected. Multiple more Gerans have entered Ukrainian airspace at this same area. If they disappear in the same area as the missile(s) did, then it will become clear what happened.

Russian forces have captured the village of Kozatske, Pokrovsk direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~190.
Total land area: ~0.88 km¬≤.

There are still no missiles detected. Multiple more Gerans have entered Ukrainian airspace at this same area. If they disappear in the same area as the missile(s) did, then it will become clear what happened.

The drones flew further west towards Chernihiv Oblast, away from where the missile(s) disappeared. Which is weird, because there was a cruise missile threat issued by the Ukrainian Airforce, and a target similar to that of a cruise missile was detected for a little under a minute.

The Kamianske Hydroelectric Power Plant in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast came under attack for the second day in a row. As many as 9 Russian Geran-2 drones impacted it at different points, resulting in large fires breaking out.   Note: the claims on Russian channels‚Ä¶
The city of Kamianske is now entirely without power following today's and yesterday's attacks on the Hydroelectric Power Plant.

Update on Russian preparations for the next large-scale, combined missile attack on Ukraine:
The Tu-95MS strategic bombers stationed at Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast have been carrying out long-range training alongside 3 IL-78 tankers in the area of the Kuril Islands of the Pacific Ocean as a part of Russia's ongoing nuclear exercises. 4-6 of them are equipped with Kh-101 cruise missiles.
1 Tu-95MS redeployed from Olenya Airbase, Murmansk Oblast, to Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast, to be equipped with missiles. Now there are 2 Tu-95MS at Engels-2, and none at Olenya. 
At least 3 Kalibr carriers stationed at Novorossiysk Naval Base, Krasnodar Krai are equipped with Kalibr cruise missiles, including one 11356R ‚ÄúAdmiral Makarov‚Äù frigate, one 11356R ‚ÄúAdmiral Essen‚Äù Frigate, and one Buyan-M corvette. 
No new deliveries of Iskander-M ballistic or Iskander-K cruise missiles to OTRK installations surrounding Ukraine have taken place over the past three days, however there are still missiles there which are available for launch, meaning that individual strikes on newly discovered targets are likely over the next 48 hours.
1 An-26 cargo plane landed at Shaykovka Airbase, Kaluga Oblast. The cargo consists of Kh-22 cruise missiles for the 7 Tu-22m3 strategic bombers currently stationed there. Some of these bombers may take part in the next large strike.
2 Tu-22m3 bombers remain stationed at Olenya Airbase. They carried out a training mission as a part of Russia's nuclear exercises. Both bombers are equipped with missiles and carried out simulated launches (likely with electronic warfare) from over the Barents Sea yesterday. 
Accumulation of Geran-2/Gebera drones continues at other launch points in preparation for their usage both in the next large-scale attack, and smaller attacks prior to that. 
5 Tu-95MS remain stationed at Diaghilev Airbase, Ryazan Oblast. They are not expected to take part in the next large-scale attack. 
3 Tu-160s are stationed at Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast. At least 1 is equipped with Kh-101 cruise missiles. 4 other Tu-160s are stationed at Ukrainka Airbase, but their status is currently unknown. 
Su-34R and Su-24MR aircraft continue to carry out intensified reconnaissance operations, especially over Rostov Oblast and Krasnodar Krai. 
No A-50U AWACS aircraft flights were recorded yesterday or today, despite their recent flight activity from Ulyanovsk-East Airbase. 
5 MiG-31Ks redeployed from Savasleika Airbase, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast, to Akhtubinsk Airbase, Astrakhan Oblast. It is from there that they launched Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles during yesterday's missile attack. 6 MiG-31Ks are currently stationed at Akhtubinsk, while none are at Savasleika. Most likely, none of them are currently equipped with missiles.

Russian forces have captured the village of Pavlivka, Hulyaipole direction, Zaporizhzhia Oblast. 
Pre-war population: ~45.
Total land area: ~0.27 km¬≤.

Near Oleksandro-Kalynove first snow fell recently, but didn‚Äôt last long. Today, too, it snowed a bit there.
Further east near Toretsk-Kostyantynivka area, still nothing, but temperatures go in the negatives often.

Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, at the European Council Summit, reaffirmed that territorial concessions are not on the table for negotiation. 
@wfwitness

Last night, several Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Ryazan Oil Refinery in Ryazan Oblast. 
At least two impacts were recorded, including 1 in the area of the hydrotreating unit and another the AVT-2 primary oil processing unit. Some sources reported that "Peklo" jet drones were used, which is possibly considering their recorded presence in the region during the night.
Ryazan Oil Refinery has previously had to operate at lower refining capacities due to Ukrainian drone strikes, with the most recent reductions taking place in August 2025. We will likely see additional reductions following today's strikes.
Hydrotreating coordinates: 54.572119, 39.741530
AVT-2 coordinates: 54.5628, 39.73749

Last night, several Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Ryazan Oil Refinery in Ryazan Oblast. 
At least two impacts were recorded, including 1 in the area of the hydrotreating unit and another the AVT-2 primary oil processing unit. Some sources reported that "Peklo" jet drones were used, which is possibly considering their recorded presence in the region during the night.
Ryazan Oil Refinery has previously had to operate at lower refining capacities due to Ukrainian drone strikes, with the most recent reductions taking place in August 2025. We will likely see additional reductions following today's strikes.
Hydrotreating coordinates: 54.572119, 39.741530
AVT-2 coordinates: 54.5628, 39.73749

Last night, Ukrainian UAVs struck the 500 kV Arzamasskaya Electrical Substation in the village of Lesnogorsk, Nizhny Novgorod Oblast. 
The substation is one of the main suppliers of energy in Nizhny Novgorod Oblast. It is used by key railway routes as well as Russia's energy corporation Gazprom. 
Coordinates: 55.09529, 43.93902

Footage showing Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on a 330 kV electrical substation in the city of Konotop, Sumy Oblast. 
Media 1 shows the strikes from a reconnaissance drone, while media 2 shows one of the strikes from the ground. At least 6 Gerans impacted the substation, resulting in a large fire breaking out and widespread power outages. 
Coordinates: 51.19231, 33.16702

Footage showing Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on a 330 kV electrical substation in the city of Konotop, Sumy Oblast. 
Media 1 shows the strikes from a reconnaissance drone, while media 2 shows one of the strikes from the ground. At least 6 Gerans impacted the substation, resulting in a large fire breaking out and widespread power outages. 
Coordinates: 51.19231, 33.16702
Russian Su-34/35s are trying to shoot down Ukrainian F-16s northwest of Sumy.
Russian Su-34/35s are trying to shoot down Ukrainian F-16s northwest of Sumy.
An explosion was heard in Sumy.

From what I've gathered, a Russian Su-35 launched an R-37M air-to-air missile from over Kursk Oblast. It was acting as an escort for Su-34s launching KAB glide-bombs at Krasnopillya, Sumy Oblast, but remained in the area after the Su-34s left.
One F-16 flew back over Sumy on a southwestern course a few minutes ago.
The F-16(s) were going to launch glide-bombs at Sudzha District, Kursk Oblast, but have been forced to abandon the combat mission.

The Russians are breaking through in the Novopavlivka direction. Their bridgehead over the Vovcha River has rapidly expanded, forcing many Ukrainian formations to withdraw from their heavily fortified positions to prevent being encircled. 
Depending how this develops, we could see Novopavlivka begin to be enveloped from the west, and the whole front west of Pokrovsk shift north/northwest towards the important logistical hub of Mezhova.
Keep an eye on this West Donetsk / East Dnipropetrovsk sector, especially once Pokrovsk and Myrnohrad fall. It could play out something like this map shows.

Why Russia Targets the Left Bank of the Dnipro: A Review of Russian-Ukrainian Strikes
October 21-22: Ukraine and Russia continued intensive mutual strikes, accompanied by massive missile and drone attacks. 
Numerous Russian strikes targeted energy facilities, including:
‚ñ™Ô∏è
CHPP-4, CHPP-5, and CHPP-6 in Kyiv.
‚ñ™Ô∏è
The Kamenska HPP in Dnipropetrovsk region.
‚ñ™Ô∏è
The Kremenchug HPP in Poltava region.
‚ñ™Ô∏è
The DniproHES in Zaporizhzhia region.
‚ñ™Ô∏è
Substations in Chernihiv and Sumy regions.
According to Telegraf, Russia is employing a new tactic aimed at completely disabling the energy system on the left bank of the Dnipro. This is creating an imbalance in power supply between western and eastern Ukraine: a critical electricity shortage is emerging in the east due to the destruction of thermal and hydroelectric plants, while a surplus of energy is present in the west, where nuclear power plants operate. This surplus cannot be effectively transferred eastward due to limited grid capacity.
üëâ

Pincers Around Uspenovka: Capture Of Pavlovka Opens New Avenues For Russian Advance To Gulyaypole
The Russian Armed Forces struck a foreign mercenaries at the Goncharovsky training camp. The 60th Separate Motorized Rifle Brigade has taken control of Pavlovka, a settlement on the right bank of the Yanchur River. 
Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico said that the veto on the 19-th package could be lifted.

Britain‚Äôs Investment In ‚ÄúCombating Russian Hybrid Threats‚Äù Sparks Instability In The Balkans
British Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper announced within the Berlin Process that the United Kingdom would invest ¬£4 million to ‚Äúcombat the constant flood of Russian hybrid threats aimed at destabilizing the region, and fanning ethnic tensions,‚Äù after which she also promised a wider ¬£10 million in programs in the Western Balkans.¬†In effect, this investment, evidently aimed against Serbia, contributes to an increasingly volatile situation in the region by implementing London‚Äôs old imperial logic of divide and rule.
Cooper hosted a meeting earlier this month within the framework of the Berlin Process, which was also attended by Serbian Foreign Minister Marko ƒêuriƒá, and at which she confirmed ‚Äúcommitment to stability, security and prosperity in the Western Balkans,‚Äù adding that the ‚Äúsecurity in the Western Balkans affects the security of the whole of Europe and the security for us here in the UK.‚Äù

U.S. Takes War On Drugs To Eastern Pacific, Strikes Two Boats There And Threatens Colombia
The United States military struck two boats allegedly carrying drugs in the eastern Pacific Ocean on October 21 and 22, in a departure from previous strikes that targeted vessels in the Caribbean Sea.
Both strikes were announced by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, who said in two separate posts on X that they were carried out ‚Äúat the direction‚Äù of President Donlad Trump. According to Hegseth, the first strike killed two people, while the second killed three.
‚ÄúThese strikes will continue, day after day. These are not simply drug runners‚Äîthese are narco-terrorists bringing death and destruction to our cities. These DTOs are the ‚ÄúAl Qaeda‚Äù of our hemisphere and will not escape justice. We will find them and kill them, until the threat to the American people is extinguished,‚Äù Hegseth said in the post announcing the second strike.
üëâ

Russian Army Reaches Key Road North Of Pokrovsk, Enters Another Town Along Yanchur 
On October 23, the Russian military reached a key road north of the city of Pokrovsk in the Donetsk direction, and entered another settlement along the Yanchur River in the Dnepropetrovsk direction.
In Donetsk, the Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces broke through Ukrainian defenses in Rodynske, located a few kilometers to the north of Pokrovsk, capturing most of the settlement southern part, and reaching the road to its west. This road links Pokrovsk with Dobropillia further to the north. It is one of the last remaining roads that Kiev has been using to supply its forces in Pokrovsk, Myrnohrad and nearby areas.
Russian troops have reportedly taken over buildings overlooking the road. However, it is unclear yet if they managed to block it. It‚Äôs worth noting that the road has been under the first of Russian drone units for a while now.
üëâ

Military Situation In Northern Palestine On October 23, 2025 (Map Update)

‚Äò31 For 1,000‚Äô: New Exchange Of Bodies Reveals Ukraine‚Äôs Heavy Losses
Ukraine announced on October 23 that it had received the bodies of 1,000 of its soldiers from Russia as part of a ‚Äúrepatriation operation.‚Äù
The country‚Äôs Coordination Headquarters for the Treatment of Prisoners of War said in a statement that investigators from law enforcement and expert institutions of the Interior Ministry will conduct examinations and identification procedures for the repatriated bodies.
It also expressed gratitude to the International Committee of the Red Cross for its assistance in the operation.
Russian State Duma Deputy Shamsail Saraliev, who represents the parliamentary coordination group on issues related to the military operation, later revealed that Russia received the remains of 31 of its soldiers in return.
